# reloadData()

**Instance Method**

Marks the table view as needing redisplay, so it will reload the data for visible cells and draw the new values.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func reloadData()
```

## Discussion

This method forces a redraw of all the visible cells in the table view. If you want to update the value in a single cell, column, or row, it is more efficient to use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/frameOfCell(atColumn:row:)], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/rect(ofColumn:)], or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/rect(ofRow:)] in conjunction with the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/setNeedsDisplay(_:)] method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView]. If you just want to update the scroller, use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/noteNumberOfRowsChanged()]; if the height of a set of rows changes, use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/noteHeightOfRows(withIndexesChanged:)].



## Related Documentation

- **noteHeightOfRows(withIndexesChanged:)**: Informs the table view that the rows specified in `indexSet` have changed height.
- **frameOfCell(atColumn:row:)**: Returns a rectangle locating the cell that lies at the intersection of the specified column and row.
- **noteNumberOfRowsChanged()**: Informs the table view that the number of records in its data source has changed.
- **rect(ofColumn:)**: Returns the rectangle containing the column at the specified index.
- **rect(ofRow:)**: Returns the rectangle containing the row at the specified index.

## Managing the Table’s Data

- **dataSource**: The object that provides the data displayed by the table view.
- **usesStaticContents**: A Boolean value indicating whether the table uses static data.
- **reloadData(forRowIndexes:columnIndexes:)**: Reloads the data for only the specified rows and columns.
